fields.summary: Modify user-integration base POM to inherit from top-level base POM

fields.description: Parent task for any Maven refactoring needed to extract duplication from child POMs into parent POMs.
fields.summary: Maven POM refactoring for AGMP

fields.description:
Minyaa plug-ins are commercial and are well supported. 

They resolve a lot of issues related to: workflow customization, auto escalation (and hence a lot of requests to use jelly scripts as well as time management)
fields.summary: Jira Studio Plugin Request: Minyaa plugins

fields.description:
Hi - 

If I run a search for "blogs" or "blog" (minus the quotes) across our instance of Jira, the wiki always returns "there is a communication problem." The search only works once I start drilling down into actual projects. 

Search works for other terms, it's just those two that return an error.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Cannot search for "blogs"

fields.description:
There is an option to change studio logo via Administration >> General >> Account tab (i.e at http://domain.jira.com/secure/admin/StudioAdministration.jspa). Clicking on the "change" link to change logo will fail with an error page (http://domain.jira.com/secure/admin/EditStudioLogo!default.jspa), either the "Mate! We're down for maintenance, we'll be right back" page or a raw 404 HTML page: {code} HTTP Status 404 - Could not execute action [EditStudioLogo!default]:Action 'EditStudioLogo' not found or could not be initialized a class with that name could not be found.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Action 'EditStudioLogo' not found or could not be initialized 
a class with that name could not be found. at com.atlassian.jira.config.webwork.
JiraActionFactory$JiraPluginActionFactory.getActionImpl
(JiraActionFactory.java:375) at webwork.action.factory.PrefixActionFactoryProxy.getActionImpl
(PrefixActionFactoryProxy.java:103) at
...
{code}
fields.summary: Error when trying to change the logo via the Administration > General > Account tab

fields.description: Currently, we have monitoring notifications for customers when disk space usage on their instance reaches 95%.  It would be helpful if this information were displayed somewhere within the web interface.
fields.summary: Display disk usage statistics in the Studio administrative interface visible to customers

fields.description:
Username conflicts are stored along with the Google user's full name and email address to make the username conflict admin page quick to load (avoiding a request to Google for every conflict).

This means that the user's full name could change after the conflict is stored, meaning that the JIRA Studio administrator is acting on false information.

To solve this, the user poller could update the Google user info (full name and email address) in the username conflict store when it runs.
fields.summary: Google users' full names may get out of sync with username conflict

fields.description:
slf4j is Studio's logging framework of choice, and since we have the ownership of AGMP now (and strive for a merge in the future) we should replace the usage of log4j throughout AGMP with slf4j.

Originally raised by Eric: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AGMP-366#c23679
fields.summary: Replace AGMP's log4j usage with slf4j

fields.description: My user icon was replaced by text! See attachment.
fields.summary: User icons sometimes do not appear in confluence

fields.description:
The google supplied Apps For Your Domain (AFYD) client throws an exception if the Google service end point is not available for some reason. It would be nice to have a wrapper around this client that has a back off strategy.

Related test failure: https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/AGMP-FULLITEST-607/test/case/115143264

Symptom stack trace in test failure:

{code}
ServerBusy(1001): AppsForYourDomainException
ServerBusy(1001): The server is busy and could not complete your request.  Please try again in 30 seconds.
	at com.google.gdata.data.appsforyourdomain.AppsForYourDomainException.narrow(AppsForYourDomainException.java:108)
	at com.google.gdata.client.appsforyourdomain.AppsForYourDomainService.insert(AppsForYourDomainService.java:102)
	at com.atlassian.agmp.integration.jira.poller.gdata.AFYDTestingClient.createUser(AFYDTestingClient.java:248)
	at com.atlassian.agmp.integration.jira.poller.gdata.AFYDTestingClient.createUser(AFYDTestingClient.java:147)
	at it.com.atlassian.agmp.integration.jira.poller.UserSyncIntegrationTest.testSyncNewUser(UserSyncIntegrationTest.java:71)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
(24 more lines...)
{code}
fields.summary: AppsForYourDomain client robustness

fields.description:
Jira 4.0 [displays last login time|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-4059] in the user browser. 
Upgrade Studio's user browser to display this information.
fields.summary: Display last login time in user browser

fields.description: http://code.google.com/p/selenium/wiki/PageObjects
fields.summary: Convert functional tests to use the page object pattern

fields.description: Blocked by http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-22454
fields.summary: Use constructor-injected loginStore instead of ComponentLocator in GoogleOpenIdFilter

fields.description:
Can you please bundle the ZenDesk plugin?

https://support.zendesk.com/attachments/token/x7pho30tb1otaj5/?name=zendesk-jira-plugin-1.4.0.3.jar

We're trying to setup ZenDesk -> JIRA integration as per https://support.zendesk.com/forums/4372/entries/38664


Thanks,
Paul
fields.summary: Support for ZenDesk Plugin

fields.description:
{panel:title=Atlassian Status as of 17 September 2014|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
Hi everyone,
 
Thanks so much for your votes and comments on this issue.
 
Atlassian is working hard on Atlassian Connect, Atlassian's strategic integration platform enabling ecosystem vendors to develop add-ons for Atlassian Cloud (OnDemand). Atlassian Connect 1.0 [was released in March 2014|http://blogs.atlassian.com/2014/03/introducing-atlassian-connect-1-0/], and you can already get access to [more than 50 public add-ons today built using the platform|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/search?application=&category=&cost=&hosting=cloud&marketingLabel=].
 
Due to stability and scalability reasons, we will not bundle additional third party add-ons with our Cloud offerings. But you should feel free to contact the vendors of your favourite add-ons to let them know that you would like them to create a Cloud version of the add-on! We will do our best to work together with the vendor to satisfy this request.
 
Since we have no plans to bundle additional add-ons in Cloud, we are closing this issue.
 
Cheers,
Bartek
JIRA Product Management
bartek (at) atlassian (dot) com
{panel}
 
 
*Original request description:*
For including math and stats formulas in wiki docs, it would be great to have the LaTeX plugin bundled by default. 

* https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/wiki/display/CLATEX/LaTeX+Plugin
fields.summary: Include the LaTeX plugin

fields.description: Developers checking in very large or inappropriate files can be a problem, e.g. large TIFF files that should be archived elsewhere.  I would like to have the ability to set a maximum file size and disallowed file types for Studio Subversion check-ins.  This is handled today by a custom hook.
fields.summary: Ability to prohibit Subversion check-in based on file size and/or type

fields.description:
By using \{gspreadsheet} in wiki (Confluence) or previewing attached spreadsheet in issues (JIRA), an error occurs:

{quote}
Service error

An error occurred while fetching the document. Please check to make sure that the document ID is valid, and that the document has not been deleted.

Error Details

bq. Received an unexpected response [code 400] for URL "https://spreadsheets.google.com/feeds/download/spreadsheets/Export?key=0AiT7eruU78798798797liRkV6d3g1X2x0S1E&exportFormat=html&gid=0&xoauth_requestor_id=user@domain.com".
{quote}

It seems that there are two things that are broken:

# There is no domain identifier in url i.e. /a/domain.com (not sure if this is by-design)
# Google doesn't allow to export in html format (but it should documented at http://code.google.com/apis/documents/docs/2.0/developers_guide_protocol.html). Switching to 'csv' format still works, for example.

This does NOT happen to Google Documents or Presentations.
fields.summary: Google Spreadsheets cannot be displayed or previewed

fields.description:
When "User Searching By Full Name" is on, the Edit screen displays it with OFF radio button checked.
When the option is off, the Edit screen displays it with neither radio button checked.

If the general configuration is edited for other reasons, this option will be turned off accidentally if the user does not inspect the option and set it back ON.

Requires a func test, therefore task points is set to 2.
fields.summary: Edit General Configuration admin screen for Issues incorrectly turns off "User Searching By Full Name", disabling auto completion for user picker fields

fields.description: Perhaps this could be split into several separate filters.
fields.summary: Decrease the size of the GoogleOpenIDFilter constructor

fields.description:
Google-apps enabled instances have the option to login to their Google Talk account and chat with others. This functionality was tough to implement and there were a number of trade-offs made. The main one is that the chat bar must be loaded through HTTP, not HTTPS.

This is a problem for many customers, as they request that their instance automatically use HTTPS, so with the chat bar loading through HTTP, some browsers will issue a mixed-mode warning (most notably IE with a very intrusive pop-up, but also Chrome).

While it probably warrants more investigation, it seems that few customers use chat functionality and it would serve the greater good to remove this feature so that we can avoid mixed-mode warnings. This would also allow us to implement AOD-2365 much more easily.
fields.summary: Remove Google Chat functionality

fields.description:
This will be fixed by google.

http://code.google.com/p/gdata-issues/issues/detail?id=2338 <-- related google issue
https://bamboo.extranet.atlassian.com/browse/AGMP-FULLITEST-592 <-- failing build
fields.summary: Failing test GSpreadsheetServletIntegrationTest

fields.description:
Currently, google apps users with suspended accounts can't access JIRA studio (at least via their google login - this should be addressed by AOD-3040), but they still contribute towards the license count. 

Users who can't access the system shouldn't contribute to the license count.
fields.summary: Exclude google users with suspended google apps accounts from license count

fields.description:
At present, when a google apps user's Google Apps account is suspended or deleted, they can still log in to JIRA studio directly by entering their JIRA studio password until the next user poller run.

We should close this time window by either:
 Preventing google users from logging into studio externally (at the UI level)
  
 OR
 
 Checking whether a user is deleted/suspended in google when a google user logs in externally
fields.summary: Prevent "Suspended" and "Deleted" Google Apps users from logging into JIRA Studio
Bamboo - Stopping All Instances action doesn't work

fields.description:
According to the Jira Studio User Guide you can add sprints in Greenhopper:

http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/GH/Adding+a+Version

But the add version link is not showing on the planning board. Via the JIRA versions you cannot add nested versions.
fields.summary: cannot add sprints in greenhopper

fields.description: These should test enough basic functionality that we have some confidence that it will work through upgrades.
fields.summary: Add functional tests for the Tempo plugin

fields.description:
When serving SVN through Apache (mod_dav_svn) there is a reasonably large overhead associated with path-based permission checking. Certain operations like {{svn log}} compound this and can make this operation on certain repositories with long histories intractable.

There is an option to disable these checks entirely, so that any authenticated user is authorised to view the entire repository, instead of just the data under the paths they have been permitted.

We probably don't want to disable this by default (as the default should be the secure option, i.e. path-based checks on: {{SVNPathAuthz on}}). It should be a configurable option that can be toggled by administrators who don't need it enabled in order to get a speed boost.

The option we need to toggle is described in detail here:
http://svnbook.red-bean.com/en/1.5/svn-book.html#svn.serverconfig.httpd.authz.pathauthzoff
fields.summary: Make SVN path-based checks optional

fields.description:
There is a new option in Jira 4.1.2 look and feel screen: "Use ISO8601 standard in Date Picker".
Studio L&F screen doesn't have that and customer is asking for it.
fields.summary: Update Look and Feel screen to mirror options in Jira 4.1.2

fields.description:
I've seen two cases in last two days when JIRA on new Studio instances didn't load studio plugins. 

Restart of JIRA solved the problem in both cases.
fields.summary: Jira doesn't load studio plugins when starting for the first time

fields.description: It would be nice if "Assigned to Me" gadget on the dashboard would either remember or be able to configure the sorting selection. Now it always changes to "Sort by priority" after every refresh.
fields.summary: "Assigned to Me" gadget to remember sorting toggle.
Add Wallboards 1.3.1 as a Studio bundled plugin
Upgrade GreenHopper to 5.2.4
Quality review for external user detection

fields.description:
There are various ways that the flag specifying whether there are any external users in the system can get out of sync. The poller should re-calculate this when it runs to correct any mismatches.

We should probably also have it log information about mismatches so we can try to fix them in the future.
fields.summary: The Google user poller should re-calculate external user flag
Detect when external users are created by adding a disabled user to a group with login permission

fields.description:
It is not possible to delete files containing "++" in a name. 

The problem is in Crowd Apache Connector, and the issue is tracked here:
http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CWD-1617
fields.summary: Impossible to delete files from SVN containing '++'

fields.description:
This issue was brought to our attention by https://support.atlassian.com/browse/JST-10792

If the logo url is protected by JIRA studio, then the user is redirected to the logo URL after logging into google because the SessionKeys.RETURN_TO attribute is set to the logo url in the session. This destination overrides the return_to paramater value in the open id request to google.

Although this is predominantly a configuration issue (the customer shouldn't use a studio protected URL as their logo), we should probably have an explicit note on the 'Look and Feel' admin page warning the customer not to do this.
fields.summary: Google Login Redirects to Logo if Logo Image is protected by studio

fields.description: I use maven 2.2.1 for our builds, which is not backwards compatible with maven 2.0.x.  I would like maven 2.2.x to be put in the default AMI for Elastic Bamboo
fields.summary: Provide Support for Maven 2.2.x in Elastic Bamboo Default AMI
After Studio 2.3 upgrade Bamboo doesn't start if grails plugin is installed

fields.description:
{quote}This Confluence installation is not licensed for additional users
You have exceeded the maximum number of users for your license. You will still be able to view content, but in order to create or edit content, you must reduce the number of active users in the installation.
There are two ways to reduce the number of active users:

Delete users
Remove the "can use" permission from users
To delete users, visit the Manage Users page.

To modify the global permissions, visit the Global Permissions page.
{quote}

It would be better if the No Access accounts were also flagged in a such a way that they are not counted towards Confluence's license count.
fields.summary: Users marked as 'No Access' but are still members of groups with Can Use Global Permissions in Confluence take up Confluence license slots

fields.description:
If you remove a user from your Google domain, the corresponding user in Studio is converted to an external user on the next poller run.

However, this does not automatically enabled the external user login form if there are no other external users in the system.
fields.summary: External user login is not enabled for Google users converted to external users during synchronisation

Hover over the login link.
The dropdown will display.
Then move off the login link but not onto the dropdown menu.
The dropdown menu stays displayed.

See screenshot.
fields.summary: Login dropdown stays open if you hover over the link then move off the link.

fields.summary: Login dropdown on gapps domains appears over firebug warning

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:

- enabled 'Require JIRA issue key for a successful commit' at host/secure/admin/SvnCommitHooks.jspa.
- make a commit against SVN while referencing a Closed ticket with the following commit message:
issuekey-911 #reopen blahblah

errors:
{code}
maleko:XYZ mtaylor$ svn commit -m "XYZ-1 #reopen blahblah"
Adding         good.txt
Transmitting file data .svn: Commit failed (details follow):
svn: Commit blocked by pre-commit hook (exit code 1) with output:
Issue XYZ-1 is not open
{code}
fields.summary: #reopen doesn't work on Closed issues while 'Require JIRA issue key for a successful commit' is enabled

fields.description:
When I click on one of the task summaries, it's opens a quick edit field.
It would be nice, that if I click on anywhere on the task board, it would clock the quick edit
fields.summary: quick edit feature in task board

fields.description: See screenshot. Firefox 3.5 on mac platform
fields.summary: horizontal scrollbar in task board module

fields.description:
The version of JMWE we're bundling with Studio 2.3 accidentally bundled the Servlet API JAR inside of it.

https://studio.plugins.atlassian.com/browse/JMWE-43

It was fixed and re-released shortly afterwards, but the version of 2.0 in our Maven repository was added a few hours before the fix was made.

Due to the nature of Maven's caching, we won't be able to just replace the 2.0 artifact, so if David doesn't cut a 2.0.1 release soon we'll need to redeploy the fixed 2.0 with a different version number. We should make it something obviously distinct from 2.0 or 2.0.1 like 2.0-studio-1 or something.

We should also test its functionality before shipping.
fields.summary: Workflow with AssignToRoleMemberFunction fails with "java.lang.LinkageError: javax/servlet/http/HttpServletRequest"

fields.description:
Customer has per project custom tabs that point to the search in Issue Navigator.
When clicking the tab, browser navigates to the Issue Navigator. The project context is lost and custom tabs too. 

Is would be nice to keep the project context.
fields.summary: Keep the project context when searching issues in Issue Navigator

fields.description:
REFER: AOD-10030

A JIRA Studio usage report which provides the user logon details will be handy to ensure 1) expected users are logging in to check the required details and 2) no unauthorised access is occurring.

We can see the events in Activity and History tabs of an issue recorded when a change occurs but can't see whether a user has logged in or not.

Atlassian Support advised to raise a support request for implementation.

Cheers
Khaseem
fields.summary: Login report

fields.description:
In Crucible 1.6, defect classifications were configured by exposing the contents of an XML file in a text area of a simple form. See:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE016/Customising+the+Defect+Classifications

Since Crucible 2, this has been updated with a proper interface:
* http://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CRUCIBLE020/Customising+the+Defect+Classifications

Studio is still using the old method of editing the XML in a form. It should be updated to expose or re-implement this new interface, because manually editing XML to change settings is horrible.
fields.summary: Expose Crucible 2's Defect Customisation editor interface

fields.description: Tempo is releasing a Studio version of their JIRA plugin which they've tested, and we need to bundle it preferably in the 2.3.1 timeframe.

fields.description: Even if we are not throwing AGMP and Studio together, Alex and I think it might be a better approach to have all integration tests in one module (similar to the studio-fireball). This way the complexity of writing integration tests decreases because we can get rid of a lot of redundant code which is there for historical reasons (different teams working on different modules). E.g. the integration tests for the GDocs REST services on the refapp are kind of redundant though already tested within the macro tests.
fields.summary: Refactor AGMP Integration Testing

fields.description:

When that is fixed and the version of JIRA that it is fixed in is merged into studio then undo the changes made to fix: AOD-2955

Move AGMP integration tests from JUnit to TestNG

fields.description: We should not be relying on CSS to hide a field for us; instead we should be not even showing the field at all. If that proves to be a bad option for maintainability then we should, at the very least, have a test case that checks that it always remains hidden. Please see: https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-265#c23142

The user can however manually type in usernames into text field and text area provide and trigger auto-completion. But the auto-completion does not open correctly, showing only a long thick black line.

fields.description:
A user who is in group 'system-administrators', but not in group 'administrators', cannot access the user picker by clicking the user picker icon on the 'Bulk Edit Access Level' (Administration -> General -> Bulk Edit Access Level) screen. The user can however manually type in usernames into text area provide and edit access levels.

When the same user is added to the 'administrators' group, the user picker is available and everything works correctly.

This is a bug because system-administrators should be able to perform any function that administrators can perform.
fields.summary: system-administrators cannot access user picker on 'Bulk Edit Access Level' screen

Upgrade to confluence 3.3.3

fields.description:
The indexing language, once a user edits application properties, gets set to "English", rather than "english", from editapplicationproperties.vm:

{noformat}
            ##JIRA Studio only supports English.
            <select id="language_select" name="language">
                <option value="English" selected>English</option>
            </select>
{noformat}

This value is invalid, and results in JIRA using the Lucene SimpleAnalyzer, which doesn't understand anything about languages, and so results in keyword search being dumb.  Additionally, it breaks existing searches, unless a reindex is done first, so for any customers that have changed their application properties, we should consider their search currently broken until a reindex is done.

So, there are three parts to fixing this:

# The comment above is wrong.  JIRA Studio only supports English translations of its i18n text.  However, content of any language can be entered into it, and its this content thats getting indexed.  Customers should be able to specify what language their content is in, and so have it indexed in that language.  Indexing it in the wrong language can actually be harmful.  This has nothing to do with translations that JIRA Studio does/doesn't support.
# An upgrade task needs to be written to update this value to "english" for all customers that have corrupt data.
# That upgrade task needs to also reindex JIRA, so that it is indexed in the correct language, so that searches work.
fields.summary: Invalid indexing language value can prevent issue searching from returning the correct results

fields.description:
I think this is a good suggestion by Alex.
See https://studio.atlassian.com/source/cru/CR-AOD-263 (comments in studiouserbrowser.vm).

At present, the Access Level column displays one of the following values:
  'Needs Activation' - if the instance is a google apps instance and the user is a google user who has never logged into Studio
  'No Access'
  'Developer'
  'Collaborator'

The User Type column displays either 'Google User' or 'External User'.

The proposal is to change the User Type column to display 3 possible values (and don't display 'Needs Activation' in the Access Level column):
  'Google User'
  'Google User (needs activation)'
  'External User'
fields.summary: Move the "Needs Activation" label in the user browser to the "User Type" column

fields.description: The result of this is that all existing Google users that are yet to be activated will create a username conflict that requires admin to manually resolve it.
fields.summary: Google users that needs activation are identified as External User because the OpenID domain attribute is not set

fields.description: If an external user is linked to a Google Apps account, the next time that user logs in (via google) they are asked to set their Studio password. They shouldn't have to do this.
fields.summary: After external user is linked with gapps account, user is asked to set password on next login

fields.description: Some JIRA Studio users might want to have the ability to pay for a backup of their JIRA Studio instance when they are not actively using it.  This could serve as an alternative to canceling an account simply because a project where Studio was being used has ended.

fields.description: The AGMP project already does this. Studio should too.

As a user, I want to be able to share a customized activity stream with other people.
As a user, I want to be able to customize which types of items appear in an activity stream.
As a user, I want to be able to integrate my JIRA Studio stream into a 3rd party app stream
As a user I want to add external atom feeds to my JIRA Studio Activity Stream.
Improve our Activity Streams
Do not allow email address of external users to be set to belong to the same Google domain of the GAPPS instance
Update terminology for user types

fields.description:
Solution:
1) Disallow unlinking a user with email address in the same Google domain?
2) Force the admin to change the email address?
3) Do not run setOpenIdDomain in reprovision mode?
4) Explicitly unset OpenID domain attribute for unlinked users?
fields.summary: Unlinking a user in reprovision mode does not remove the OpenID domain attribute from the user if the user's email address belongs to the same Google domain
